text.0: ask ye of him for he is come he knoweth it he full of wisdom is implored is now implored.
text.1: with him are admonitions and with him commands he is the lord of strength the lord of power and might.
text.2: they ask of him not all learn by their questioning what he the sage hath grasped as twere with his own mind.
text.3: forgetting not the former nor the later word he goeth on not careless in his mental power.
text.4: to him these ladles go to him these racing mares he only will give ear to all the words i speak.
text.5: allspeeding victor perfecter of sacrifice the babe with flawless help hath mustered vigorous might.
text.6: whateer he meets he grasps and then runs farther on and straightway newly born creeps forward with his kin.
text.7: he stirs the wearied man to pleasure and great joy what time the longing gifts approach him as he comes.
text.8: he is a wild thing of the flood and forest he hath been laid upon the highest surface.
text.9: he hath declared the lore of works to mortals agni the wise for he knows law the truthful.
